channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Summer's back (briefly)! Britain is set for 73F sun today but cooler week to follow
item.description: Strong winds which battered parts of the UK are expected to ease after gusts of up to 70mph buffeted parts of the south-west of England and Wales on Friday, triggering warnings from the RNLI.

item.title: Oldham council enlists celebrities to tackle 'confusing' Covid messaging
item.description: Oldham Council leader Sean Fielding said that he had recruited the Pakistani cricket captain and the actor who played Jay in the TV series The Inbetweeners to spread messaging.

item.title: Tory MP Johnny Mercer gives thumbs up as reveals huge black eye from canoeing accident
item.description: The Plymouth Moor View MP was canoeing down the Tamar River when he got into difficulty, and ended up with a nasty cut above his eye.

item.title: 'Poisoned' Putin critic Alexei Navalny is flown out of Russia for emergency care in Germany
item.description: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was pictured being loaded into a plane which took off from an airport in the Siberian city of Omsk just after 8am local time.

item.title: Volunteers filter into German arena so scientists can track how Covid-19 may spread at indoor events
item.description: Participants this morning lined up to take part in the RESTART-19 transmission risk assessment at Leipzig arena.

item.title: Harry Maguire 'fought outside Greek bar after his sister was stabbed in the arm' local media claims
item.description: A brawl kicked off after rival fans shouted 'F*** United'. His sister Daisy was then stabbed in the arm with a 'sharp object' and Maguire stepped in to defend her, according to local media.

item.title: Teenage girl, 19, killed herself over fears she was 'losing her freedom' in lockdown
item.description: Emily Owen, 19, was found by her mother and sister at their home in Shouldham, Norfolk, after the family decided to self-isolate because one of Emily's sisters had a cough.

item.title: Covid will be present 'FOREVER', warns SAGE scientist
item.description: Professor Sir Mark Walport said that, like flu, repeat inoculations will be required to control outbreaks in the UK - but Covid-19 will never be 'eradicated by vaccination' like smallpox was.

item.title: Man dies after 'being blasted in chest' as three men and a woman arrested on suspicion of murder
item.description: The 58-year-old, who has not been named, died in hospital after suffering serious injuries to his chest in Carlin How in Redcar, Teesside, at 4.30pm on Friday.

item.title: The Masked Singer SHUT DOWN due to a coronavirus outbreak
item.description: The Masked Singer Australia set has been shut down amid a coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Grant Shapps hints Britain could have 'regionalised' air bridges to Spain
item.description: Grant Shapps said ministers are examining the possibility of 'regional travel corridors' which could allow quarantine-free flights from destinations such as the Canaries or Balearics.

item.title: Facebook reportedly planning a kill switch to shut off political ads if Trump disputes election
item.description: Facebook is looking at post-election scenarios that include attempts by President Donald Trump or his campaign to use the platform to delegitimize the results, according to a report on Friday.

item.title: BBC will spend £100million chasing TV licence fees
item.description: The BBC is set to spend around £100million of taxpayers' cash chasing the TV licence fee and hauling non-payers to court this year after the over-75s were told to cough up.

item.title: Polish immigrant who fled Britain after horror smash that killed a father is jailed for eight years
item.description: David Grant-Jones, 49, died at the scene following the horror 100mph smash in Dorset. Adrian Wojciechowski, 29, fled from the UK to Poland before he was due to stand trial.

item.title: EastEnders' Adam Woodyatt splits from wife of 22 years
item.description: The actor, 52, is best known for his role as Ian Beale on EastEnders which he has had since the soap's first episode in 1985. He is said to have split from Beverley in August last year.

item.title: Natalie Acquisto of 'Natchats' is one of Australia's only professional female gamers
item.description: Natalie Acquisto, 26, from Perth, tried various jobs before deciding to make a change and turn her passion for gaming into a career.

item.title: Freshers' week on ZOOM: Independent SAGE says first years should be banned from partying next month
item.description: UK experts have earmarked campuses as potential super-spreading zones, because young people are more likely to carry the virus without knowing and mingle with strangers.

item.title: Britain could go into a SECOND national lockdown if it sees rise in cases like Spain, official warns
item.description: While local lockdowns in Manchester, Oldham and Leicester have already been implemented, the Prime Minister appeared to rule out another national lockdown last month.

item.title: Expert reveals how to get your child back into a routine NOW ahead of returning to school
item.description: Psychologist Hope Bastine tells FEMAIL how getting your children's sleep routine back on track now can play an influential role in encouraging a positive back-to-school transition.

item.title: First-time buyers and families are facing chaos when applying for a mortgage
item.description: Mortgage firms are axing deals at the last minute as they struggle to cope with tide of applications after stamp duty cut. Kelly Nixon nearly missed her first home when her deal with Lloyds was pulled.

item.title: 'Deeply romantic' British country house features in Old Homes, New Life by Clive Aslet
item.description: Clive Aslet's Old Homes, New Life: The Resurgence of the British Country House gives a behind-the-scenes account of the family of Lucy Chenevix-Trench at Madresfield Court, Worcestershire.

item.title: Police 'desperately' searching for 12-year-old girl who left Brighton home at 9pm
item.description: Grace Clarke, described as white, 5', with long dark hair, left her house in the Hollingdean area of Brighton around 9pm on Friday, the UK's third day experiencing the windy storm.

item.title: One in three Brits are having vegan milk in cups of tea as shoppers opt for dairy-free products
item.description: While vegan-friendly almond, soya and coconut milk alternatives always seemed to be the preserve of trendy millennials, it seems Britons of all ages are now opting for dairy-free milk.

item.title: Pictured: Schoolgirl, 15, who fell into swollen Welsh river and drowned during Storm Ellen
item.description: Schoolgirl Nicola Williams had been playing with friends on the banks of the River Rhymney in Cardiff when she fell into the fast-flowing water and drowned.

item.title: Prince Charles' former aide denies introducing student to Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: Eileen Guggenheim, the former Prince's Trust vice-chair and current dean of the New York Academy of Art, was accused of encouraging a student to flirt with Epstein because he was a big donor.

item.title: Nick Faldo is to marry 'former topless dancer' Lindsay De Marco and become her seventh husband
item.description: Golf star Nick Faldo, 63, and Lindsay de Marco, 57, announced their engagement on social media posting a picture showing her wearing a glitzy ring and captioning a thread of emojis.

item.title: Police hunt armed robber who pulled a GUN on shop clerk
item.description: The armed robbery, in Plumstead Common in South East London, was caught on CCTV so the police were able to release video and photographs of the man they are looking for.

item.title: Counter-terror police arrest man, 33, amid fears of an explosive at property
item.description: The 33-year-old man was arrested in the tiny village of Paulton, Somerset, as part of an investigation by Counter Terrorism Policing South East and South West.

item.title: Boris Johnson and Rishi Sunak at war over pension reform
item.description: Rishi Sunak is said to be concerned by the 'anomaly' of the mechanism used to calculate state pensions and is looking to either reform or scrap it in an autumn budget.

item.title: Sudanese migrants in France say they will NEVER give up trying to cross Channel
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: One migrant even admitted he had 'a small boat buried' under the sand at the same Sangatte beach where the body of the tragic victim was washed up yesterday.

item.title: Madeleine McCann prime suspect Christian Brueckner 'had an accomplice', witness says
item.description: Christian Brueckner was seen with a blond man the night he was arrested for allegedly exposing himself to four children, aged eight to 12, in the village of Messines in 2017.

item.title: Wife of Covid-19 survivor who spent 110 days in hospital admits she feared she'd end up a widow
item.description: Mick Pickering, 65, from Newthorpe, was admitted to Nottingham City Hospital on April 4 and put into an induced coma five days later. He and wife Patsy appeared on BBC Breakfast today.

item.title: DR MAX PEMBERTON: To hell with Covid! Children MUST go back to school
item.description: DR MAX PEMBERTON: This week has been an emotional roller-coaster for A-level and GCSE pupils. I have every sympathy with them as politicians, exam regulators and teachers play the blame game.

item.title: Blockbusters are back... with a baddie to make Bond blush! KATE MUIR reviews Tenet
item.description: KATE MUIR: Christopher Nolan's spy thriller Tenet is a mind-boggling and time-bending spectacle: A hugely anticipated blockbuster which should end months of darkness in cinemas.

item.title: No lockdown, no hysteria... DOMINIC SANDBROOK asks: Is Sweden proof we got it all terribly wrong?
item.description: DOMINIC SANDBROOK: Closing schools was 'meaningless'. Shutting borders was 'ridiculous'. Masks were, by and large, a waste of time. Shops and restaurants should stay open.

item.title: Ciara Charteris had a 'decent case' against her rapist until her confidante refused to give evidence
item.description: Ciara Charteris has revealed she had a 'decent case' against the close friend who she says raped her - but the woman she confided in refused to give evidence.

item.title: Husband is left paralyzed after being hit by stray bullet while walking with wife in Brooklyn
item.description: Sam Metcalfe, 33, a resident of the Flatbush section of Brooklyn, was left paralyzed on Wednesday after he was shot while walking with his wife, Sabrina, to the store to buy toothpaste.

item.title: Voters blast Boris Johnson for his silence on exams fiasco
item.description: A Daily Mail poll has revealed the depth of feeling about getting pupils back into class full time with a huge majority believing it should be the top priority for ministers.

item.title: Fitness model,74, becomes Instagram sensation with over 800,000 followers
item.description: Joan MacDonald, 74, from Cobourg, Canada, has become a fitness model after losing 62lb (over 4st) because of her high blood pressure and arthritis.

item.title: Latte made with Instagram-friendly edible flower ice cubes goes viral on TikTok
item.description: Hong Kong-based @Samishome posted a video on TikTok in which she was seen making ice cubes with edible flowers in them. She then dropped them into a glass with milk and coffee.

item.title: Heidi Klum granted emergency court hearing with ex-husband Seal to determine if kids can travel
item.description: In a court filing obtained by DailyMail.com , the Grammy Award-winning singer is concerned about them traveling to the European country amid the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Joe Biden says he would shut country back down to fight coronavirus pandemic
item.description: Joe Biden said he would shut down the country again if scientists said it was needed to fight the coronavirus outbreak in an interview with ABC alongside running mate Kamala Harris on Friday.

item.title: Finding Freedom reveals largesse Meghan and Harry have received
item.description: Finding Freedom - the Harry and Meghan biography - shares details about private jets being proffered and houses being loaned - or rented for a price well below market value.

item.title: Kamala Harris is PRANKED by Russian hoaxers who pose as Greta Thunberg and her father
item.description: Kamala Harris (left), the Democratic nominee for vice president, was pranked by two Russian hoaxers - Vladimir 'Vovan' Kuznetsov (seen left in the image on the right) and Alexei 'Lexus' Stolyarov.

item.title: Mourner from Robert Trump's funeral 'punches restaurant worker in the face'
item.description: An unidentified person in the funeral party allegedly assaulted a server at Fig & Olive restaurant in Washington DC Friday night, according to reports from NBC.

item.title: British actress tears Hollywood apart: Affairs, blackmail claims and two married bosses out of jobs
item.description: Charlotte Kirk played centre stage in a tawdry saga of blackmail and extortion this week. Ron Meyer, vice chairman of NBC-Universal, resigned after claiming he was blackmailed over an affair.

item.title: Ofqual boss threatened to quit unless Gavin Williamson gave his public backing
item.description: Roger Taylor, Ofqual's chairman, (pictured) demanded a public statement of support from Gavin Williamson in wake of Government's U-turn over A-level and GCSE results.

item.title: How much does it cost to charter a private jet from the UK?
item.description: It appears many are looking to travel like royalty, with private flight bookings at one specialist company up hugely in the last few months.

item.title: MARINA LITVINENKO: My husband was fatally poisoned. My reaction to this new barbarism? NOT AGAIN
item.description: MARINA LITVINENKO: When my husband Alexander Litvinenko woke in the night 13 years ago to be violently sick, I didn't think he'd been poisoned.

item.title: Mother of Daisy Coleman reveals she killed herself after finding out she couldn't have children
item.description: Melinda Coleman revealed that her daughter Daisy, 23, killed herself shortly after learning she couldn't have children and hours after she reported having a stalker.

item.title: Two of Larry King's children have died in the past month
item.description: Larry King's son Andy, 65, died suddenly on July 28 from what his family believe to be a heart attack. Andy was followed by his sister Chaia, 52, who died on Wednesday.

item.title: Donald Trump cuts a somber figure at White House funeral for younger brother Robert
item.description: Trump held a private funeral service at the White House Friday afternoon for his younger brother Robert who died last week aged 71.

item.title: Dashcam captures terrifying drive through California wildfires that have killed six
item.description: Horrifying footage (left) shows cars driving through the raging flames of the Hennessey Fire in Napa County Friday, as California continues to be at the peril of 560 fires.

item.title: Sofia Vergara speaks on Ellen DeGeneres: 'I was never a victim guys, I was always in on the joke'
item.description: Sofia Vergara is insisting that she was not the butt of Ellen DeGeneres's jokes. On Friday, the Modern Family star, 48, attempted to clear the air with a tweet about the embattled daytime host.

item.title: Prosecutors could charge more of Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking co-conspirators
item.description: The federal grand jury investigation into alleged sex trafficking by Jeffrey Epstein and his 'madam,' Ghislaine Maxwell, is ongoing and could net additional charges against co-conspirators.

item.title: British schoolgirl who joined ISIS with her twin sister moved to high-security Syrian detention camp
item.description: Salma and Zahra Halane fled their home in Manchester in June 2014 to travel to Syria when they were 16 years old. Zahra is reported to have been transferred to Roj camp in northeast Syria.

item.title: Heroic moment three-year-old boy saves his friend, also three, from drowning in a pool
item.description: The incident took place earlier this month at farm home in Itaperuna, a city northern Rio de Janeiro, while the children were alone at the pool.

item.title: PC Andrew Harper's father, 55, supports his widow's call for life prison terms for police killers
item.description: Phil Harper, 55, (pictured) said a new law is needed to impose tougher sentences on criminals who target the people who are 'the backbone of this country'.

item.title: Levis stand the test of time to be named history's most iconic fashion item of all time
item.description: Britons have had their say on the most iconic fashion items of all time and Levi's 501 jeans have come in top. The denim staple has been in production since 1873 - and remains popular to this day.

item.title: Thousands of patients in England will benefit from a 'transformational' cystic fibrosis drug
item.description: NHS patients will be some of the first in Europe to be prescribed the drug after it was given the go-ahead by regulators on Friday.

item.title: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Look out Boris! Your ex 'special friends' are best buddies...
item.description: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Just when Boris Johnson thought it couldn't get any worse, two of his reputed former lovers are making common cause.

item.title: Beirut's port finally opens again for aid shipments
item.description: In photographs taken today, aid ships can be seen moored off Beirut's flattened port. The blast, which took place on August 4, killed 171 people and injured thousands more.

item.title: Storm Ellen: Human chain formed to rescue Dorset swimmers
item.description: A human chain formed at Durdle Door, Dorset, after two beachgoers got into trouble. More than 30 people formed a link to bring them both in safely.

item.title: Scientists invent new 'infinitely recyclable' plastic, PBTL
item.description: Most plastics degrade when they're recycled. But scientists have developed a new kind of plastic, called PBTL, that retains its strength no matter how many times it's broken down and remolded.

item.title: Grand Canyon cliff collapse reveals footprints made by egg-laying animals 313 MILLION years ago
item.description: A collapse in Grand Canyon National Park sent a boulder falling down the side of a mountain that held the oldest vertebrate tracks. Experts say the two sets were made 313 million years ago.

item.title: Ancient Mars was FLOODED during storms that could have lasted thousands of years
item.description: Ancient Mars is believed to of had storms that filled lakes and rivers to the point of flooding. Experts say the storms may have lasted for thousands of years, producing 150 feet of rainfall or snowmelt.

item.title: AMANDA PLATELL: I do admire BoJo - but I can't bear his no-show
item.description: AMANDA PLATELL: What was Boris thinking, hiding away in Scotland when the country yearned for leadership? A couple of tweets was all we got. Who does he think he is, Donald Trump?

item.title: Families of victims of Shoreham Airshow tragedy are still waiting for answers five years on
item.description: Family has expressed frustration and said the victims are being treated as secondary because of legal restrictions on evidence at the inquest, which has been delayed because of Covid-19

item.title: Bombshell in the briefcase: New book retells one of the greatest Cold War thrillers of all
item.description: The discovery of the attaché case marked the beginning of the unravelling of the Portland Spy Ring, one of the most significant anti-espionage operations ever carried out in this country.

item.title: Roads boss who oversaw 'death trap' smart motorways quits his £456,000 job at Highways England
item.description: Jim O'Sullivan has played down the risks posed by smart motorways - where the hard shoulder is removed to ease congestion - despite evidence they have caused dozens of deaths

item.title: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: David Beckham's hires properly posh aide
item.description: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: David Beckham's transformation from working-class hero to country squire is complete.

item.title: Children's rotting teeth cost the NHS more than £40million last year
item.description: Hospitals carried out almost 180 operations every day on children and teens last year to remove rotting teeth, costing the NHS more than £40 million - up from £27.4 million the previous year.

item.title: RUTH SUNDERLAND: £2trillion of debt - here's one horrific bill Dishy Rishi CAN'T just wave away
item.description: RUTH SUNDERLAND: For anyone still indulging in the fantasy that life can be one long furlough, the speed with which our national debt has surged above £2trillion should come as a wake-up call.

item.title: Dermot O'Leary reveals his wedding ring has been stolen
item.description: Television and radio presenter Dermot O'Leary has revealed his wedding ring was stolen from a gym in central London after sharing a police appeal on Twitter to find the alleged thief.

item.title: Ministers must do more to get workers into the office amid fears economic recovery will be hampered
item.description: The survey, conducted by JL Partners, found that 47 per cent want the Government to step up efforts to encourage employees back to their desks.

item.title: Covid pandemic could last for another TWO YEARS says World Health Organisation chief
item.description: World Health Organisation chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said globalisation allowed the virus to spread quicker than the Spanish Flu did in 1918.

item.title: Chicago mobster Frank Cullotta, inspiration for the film Casino, dies of coronavirus aged 81
item.description: Frank Cullotta, a Chicago-born mobster who ran the infamous Las Vegas burglary squad known as the Hole in the Wall Gang, has died of coronavirus and other complications at the age of 81.

item.title: Dr MICHAEL MOSLEY tried frying one half of his face at 400C to look younger
item.description: Dr MICHAEL MOSLEY: Take a set of titanium rods. Heat them to 400c and apply the tip straight to your face. This is thermal ablation, one of the latest cosmetic 'tweakments' on the market.

item.title: New Cannonball Run record is set in just 25 hours and 39 minutes - thanks to coronavirus
item.description: Doug Tabbutt, of Twinsburg, Ohio, and Arne Toman, of Chicago, made the 2,816 mile drive from New York City to Los Angeles in an Audi S6 disguised as a Ford Taurus Police Interceptor.

item.title: California's 'Golden State Killer' sentenced to life in...
item.description: Joseph James DeAngelo, 74, was ordered to serve life in prison without the possibility of parole, following four days of emotional hearings in which victims confronted him in open court.

item.title: Trump reveals he thinks Joe Biden is 'more likable' than Hillary after convention stresses empathy
item.description: President Donald Trump compared Hillary Clinton and Joe Biden during a Friday speech, saying Clinton was 'much smarter' while allowing Biden was 'more likable.'

item.title: BBC re-edits 'Nick' documentary after victims say Tom Watson's role in scandal was airbrushed
item.description: The BBC has been forced to hastily re-edit a documentary into VIP abuse fantasist 'Nick' after victims complained Tom Watson's role was airbrushed out.

item.title: After three fatalities just this summer, heartbroken parents are in despair over dangers of jet skis
item.description: They can be raced by 12-year-olds at 60mph with no training or licence, but after three jet ski fatalities this summer, heartbroken family members who've lost loved ones have spoken out about dangers

item.title: Loneliness of locked down TV star: JOHN BARROWMAN describes fatherhood
item.description: John Barrowman, the perennially upbeat, affable and incontestably happy Mr Nice Guy, is feeling uncharacteristically glum during the coronavirus lockdown but has decided to pursue fatherhood.

item.title: BEL MOONEY: Has my bullying husband now got dementia?
item.description: This week Bel advises a reader who feels certain her bullying husband is showing early signs of dementia.

item.title: Coronavirus US: NYC luxury real estate hit 'harder than 9/11'
item.description: In the second quarter, the number of luxury co-op and condo closings in Manhattan was down 54 percent from last year, and the median sales price was down 11 percent.

item.title: New honey from Prince Charles' own bees on his country estate costs £25 for a 350g jar
item.description: Four hundred pots of honey from Prince Charles's hives at his Gloucestershire home have gone on sale for £25 for a 350g jar, with the proceeds going to charities supported by Charles.

item.title: Is the National Trust turning into a national joke? GUY ADAMS investigates
item.description: GUY ADAMS: Back in 1902, a newly formed heritage charity called the National Trust acquired its first Welsh building: a Georgian landmark outside the border town of Monmouth.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: SAGE fears R rate could be as high as 1.1
item.description: Department of Health chiefs announced another 1,033 Covid-19 cases - down from the 1,441 recorded last Friday. It means 992 Britons are now being diagnosed with the illness every day.

item.title: Coronavirus China: Drinkers break rules at Wuhan beer festival
item.description: A week-long beer festival kicked off in Wuhan last weekend, which has seen thousands flock to attend the festivities. Visitors were pictured standing shoulder to shoulder amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Bear wanders into a California grocery store, grabs a bag of Tostitos
item.description: Adina Baidoo had been shopping at a Lake Tahoe, California, Safeway when she encountered the brown bear on Tuesday.

item.title: Five more migrants risk 10ft gales to make perilous Channel crossing to the UK
item.description: The five who arrived today presented themselves as Sudanese and Chad nationals after making the perilous 21-mile trip across the Dover Strait, tackling fierce winds and choppy sea conditions.

item.title: Boy, 13, fights for life after suffering head injuries in 'hit and run'
item.description: Emergency services were called to Melbury Avenue in Poole at 2.27pm this afternoon following the collision, which involved a pedestrian, the 13-year-old local boy, and a grey Mercedes A-Class.

item.title: Manchester Arena terrorists' brother supports jail sentence
item.description: Ismali Abedi has spoken out about the Manchester Arena attack orchestrated by his two younger brothers, Hashem and Salman, in 2017 which left 22 people dead.

item.title: BTEC students are promised their results by the end of next week amid last-minute delay
item.description: Pearson, the awarding organisation of BTECs, has apologised toUK pupils following its decision to pull the results despite previously being aware of problems with the algorithm.

item.title: Councillor jailed for four years arranged to meet girl, 3, for sex
item.description: Alex Kear, 50, has been was jailed for four years and ordered to serve an extended licence period of two years after his trial held at Leeds Crown Court earlier today.

item.title: Boy racers ram each other's cars in UK 'demolition derby'
item.description: Reckless drivers smashed their cars and sped down the A10 at Waterbeach towards Ely, Cambridgeshire, during a 'demolition derby'. Shocking footage shows the cars spin off the road.

item.title: Private Islamic school that allowed teacher to show children a pro-ISIS video given official warning
item.description: Umar Ahmed Haque, 25, a former teacher at the Lantern of Knowledge Muslim boys School in east London, was charged with disseminating terrorist material to children in 2018.

item.title: EasyJet plane hit by bird makes emergency return to Liverpool
item.description: The aircraft was travelling to Jersey when it was spotted making a diversion, and then heading back to John Lennon Airport.

item.title: Mother, 45, 'hysterical with grief' after she survives car crash that killed her family in Ireland
item.description: Geraldine Mullan, 45, was the sole survivor of a car crash that killed her husband and two children in Donegal last night. Her husband John Mullan, 49, and children Tomas 14, and Amelia, six, died.

item.title: Scientists grow the first functioning mini human heart model
item.description: The human heart organoids, which have functioning chambers and vascular tissue, were created with stem cells to mimic the 'nuts and bolts' of how a fetal heart develops in the womb .

item.title: Small spongy bone was key to supporting huge dinosaurs
item.description: The team of engineers and palaeontologists say hadrosaurs could inspire designs in aerospace and construction for their remarkable biomechanics.

item.title: Malta's former PM Joseph Muscat is formally questioned by cops for over murder of journalist
item.description: Malta's ex PM Joseph Muscat was questioned by police on this afternoon about reports given to police by suspected mastermind in the murder of anti-corruption journalist Daphne Caruana Galizia.

item.title: Police force uses podcast in bid to crack 23-year-old unsolved murder of delivery driver
item.description: Derbyshire Constabulary have created a 64-minute podcast about the murder of Michael Pritchard, 54, (pictured) who was killed in Kirk Langley, Derbyshire, in November 1997.

item.title: Murder suspect accused of killing women and putting bodies in his freezer 'panicked', court hears
item.description: Zahid Younis, a suspected double killer who allegedly kept his victims' bodies in a freezer for nearly three years told a jury he 'just panicked' when he found one of the victims dead on his sofa in Canning Town.

item.title: Families describe four young men who were killed in a car crash as 'loving rays of sunshine'
item.description: The families of the four men, who were all from Calne in Wiltshire, said their deaths left massive voids in their lives. Pictured, scorch marks outside the house their car crashed into.

item.title: Storage Hunters star is spared jail after trying to contact hunky antiques dealer she'd stalked
item.description: Boudicca Scherazade, 48, bombarded furniture dealer Laurence Roche with explicit emails, texts and voicemails, and was barred from contacting him when she was convicted in 2016.

item.title: Scottish retreat where Boris Johnson stayed during exams crisis
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson's Great Escape descended into farce this afternoon after it emerged he had camped in a local sheep farmer Kenny Cameron's field without permission.

item.title: Man supports boy, 6, dangling from tower block for over an hour
item.description: The six-year-old had fallen out of the flat while being left unattended in China, according to state media. The saviour climbed across the building's façade with his bare hands to rescue the child.

item.title: Police were called to 40 illegal house parties in Manchester in a single night
item.description: Police in Manchester dealing with around 2,000 extra calls a week about people failing to follow lockdown regulations. At one large house party in Stockport, a female officer was punched in the face.

item.title: PayPal chase man for £19k after son, 6, bought truck on eBay
item.description: Mohammad Faraji, from Wallsend, North Tyneside accidentally left his laptop logged on and his six-year-old, monster truck obsessed, son Ario was browsing eBay behind his back.

item.title: Afghan refugees lose legal case against Home Office over conditions at immigration removal centre
item.description: Three Afghan refugees took legal action over conditions at Brook House IRC, near Gatwick Airport, where they say detainees were locked in their 'cells'. But a judge has dismissed their claims.

item.title: Erdogan turns another ancient Istanbul church into a mosque
item.description: The Kariye Museum, or Chora Church, in Istanbul, Turkey (pictured) will be converted into a place of Muslim worship by order of Turkey's President Erdogan. The change was announced on Friday.

item.title: Human natural selection adding to 'nearsightedness epidemic'
item.description: Researchers from the US have found that many of the genetic variants that cause nearsightedness, or myopia, are associated with reproductive benefits.

item.title: Missing baby albino kangaroo feared stolen from German zoo
item.description: Mila the baby albino kangaroo has gone missing from the zoo in Kaiserlautern, Germany, with authorities unable to rule out the possibility that the animal was stolen from the zoo.

item.title: Extinction Rebellion protests world's largest residential ship
item.description: An offshoot of the environmental group, Ocean Rebellion, led a protest against The World in Falmouth, Cornwall. They said it is the first of many protest actions planned for the ocean.

item.title: Lawyers for Lockerbie bomber say they should be allowed to see secret Government papers
item.description: Lawyers for Abdelbaset al-Megrahi's family said it is 'in the interest of justice' that the defence get to see the two documents, which are covered by a public interest immunity certificate.

item.title: Criminal legal aid lawyers could get a pay rise after government pledges extra £51million
item.description: Although industry leaders have welcomed the 'desperately needed' extra funding they have warned that the legal aid sector needs more money. It was called a 'small step in the right direction'.

item.title: New Zealand man who hugged quarantining friend JAILED for six weeks for breaking coronavirus rules
item.description: Jesse Courtney Welsh, 33, has been jailed in New Zealand after he broke lockdown rules after hugging an isolating friend at the Crowne Plaza hotel in Auckland after they returned from Australia.

item.title: Son, 26, who stabbed his mother and stepfather to death is jailed for at least 36 years
item.description: Anmol Chana, 26, who was jailed at Birmingham Crown Court today, contacted a female escort, went to a pub and 'calmly' played pool after killing his mother and stepfather at their West Midlands home.

item.title: Healthy heart linked with low risk of eye disease and sight loss
item.description: US researchers have linked good cardiovascular health from a healthy diet, regular exercise and not smoking with lower odds for ocular diseases.

item.title: Back to school for JUST £15: Sainsbury's launches the cheapest children uniforms in the UK
item.description: Parents are able to purchase a new whole set of schooling attire for just £15 from Sainsbury's - £30 cheaper than John Lewis, who proved to be the least value for money.

item.title: Stunning £3.2m five-bed mansion can be yours for just £10
item.description: The fully-renovated property sits on top of a hill and overlooks the picturesque sea near Portsmouth harbour in Hampshire.

item.title: Healthy two-headed calf born in village in China
item.description: Video footage of the cow in a village in Dejiang County, China's Guizhou Province, shows the mutant baby animal with two heads, two ears, two mouths and four eyes. An expert said it was healthy.

item.title: Warner Bros is investigating the production of Justice League
item.description: US actor Ray Fisher - who made allegations of 'unacceptable' conduct against director Joss Whedon last month - said that WarnerMedia had launched an independent third-party probe.

item.title: Pence calls DNC 'grim, negative and very hostile' after Biden torches Trump
item.description: Vice President Mike Pence complained Friday that the DNC was 'grim' and 'very negative, very hostile' after Joe Biden torched President Trump's tenure as the nation's 'season of darkness.'

item.title: UK firm to convert 30 vintage Rolls-Royces into electric cars
item.description: Lunaz, which specialises in ripping petrol engines out of classic cars and replacing them with batteries and electric motors, will create 30 electrified Phantom Vs and Silver Cloud models.

item.title: Terrifying 980ft-high glass walkway extends from cliff in China
item.description: The A-shaped, see-through platform protrudes from a cliff face at more than 300 metres (984 feet) above the ground in China. New footage shows tourists moving around cautiously on the walkway.

item.title: Sudanese migrant who drowned in Channel shown with survivor
item.description: EXCLUSIVE Ahmed Al-Somali, 17, was with his best friend tragic Sudanese migrant Abdulfatah Hamdalla as the pair rowed towards Britain using oars as paddles.

item.title: Belarusian opposition leader Svetlana Tikhanovskaya makes first speech from exile
item.description: Svetlana Tikhanovskaya, called for political prisoners to be freed, violence to stop, and free elections to be held as soon as possible in her first speech from exile in Lithuania.

item.title: Teenager who killed himself has achieved top marks in one of his exams
item.description: Matthew Mackell's father Michael Bond found out that his son, who was in his first year of sixth form at Skinners' Kent Academy in Tunbridge Wells, Kent, achieved an A in his favourite subject.

item.title: Killer whale uses tail to toss seal 40ft into the air in British Columbia
item.description: A boat tour captain has captured the incredible moment a Bigg's orca flicked an unlucky seal high into the air using its tail as it splashed around in the water Sidney Island, British Columbia, Canada.

item.title: Sudanese migrant Abdulfatah Hamdallah's family blame French for refusing his asylum bid
item.description: The family of a migrant who tragically drowned while crossing the Channel have blamed French authorities - after they rejected his asylum claim
